stix:STIX_Header.stix:Title: Phishing Email with Blank Body Contains Incomplete Malicious Attachment
stix:STIX_Header.stix:Description: On 4 February 2015, a phishing email with the subject "=?UTF-8?B?bmjDom4gdmnDqm4gdGjDtG5nIHRpbg==?=" was observed. The subject is a base-64 encoded string that translates to "nhân viên thông tin". The email was sent from "phuonghoa1708@gmail.com" and included a malicious attachment, PPF_D6.doc (MD5: 7B3C797DA551BA199F2434696880DEE5), that was cut off. The malicious attachment contains code to exploit CVE-2012-0158. It also contained an embedded file that was incomplete. The file would not be successful in exploiting any system because of this, however, it did contain a domain, "dangcongsan.vn", to communicate with.

stix:Indicator.indicator:Description:
----- BEGIN EMAIL HEADER ----- EHLO mail-we0-f193.google.com MAIL FROM:<phuonghoa1708@gmail.com> SIZE=562396 RCPT TO:[REDACTED] Received: by mail-we0-f193.google.com with SMTP id k11so593523wes.0 for [REDACTED]; Wed, 04 Feb 2015 21:01:36 -0800 (PST) DKIM-Signature: v=1; a=rsa-sha256; c=relaxed/relaxed; d=gmail.com; s=20120113; h=mime-version:date:message-id:subject:from:to:content-type; bh=BQuFAOmYi1vn+nlB7DMfJJ7IoBJg2dYqnBOhQPRxCII=; b=skRx2U0ieu3AzkAAAW6njB9jaqEpjaT3oH7214jvMJb2rU4+KTbGj6+vH6F41gm8ES t85SH2bmGR6IXsHx56ElYxg5wh+11iF+Y8If3U8L2yNv5ynk9jXjbaGMJHAhHlecyUUf Py/PQHiTGxW1RQUyd3rZlSP+u15FGsGlcZSB2iPrsX7jOE6fvdnxzkTqZVfTJPfmaXb+ fJ+YTH08nrA6Y/r3fKrMMjOaRN627FqL3E4FOZt9azFNA7Q/HNQp2H6lyFKx4R4pj4nq mZC0LYlY/k6IKymPWEeoweELfXLUbhkQCyhxCD0A3AreOYSp/sT78GCnVbTgJea44HCV higg== MIME-Version: 1.0 X-Received: by 10.180.77.113 with SMTP id r17mr7874759wiw.8.1423112495807; Wed, 04 Feb 2015 21:01:35 -0800 (PST) Received: by 10.194.175.33 with HTTP; Wed, 4 Feb 2015 21:01:35 -0800 (PST) Date: Thu, 5 Feb 2015 12:01:35 +0700 Message-ID: <CAFcau2Dt55neACZisZOC7oK3zVHTZu9Ar47ShZZbW7=Fjm8WxA@mail.gmail.com> Subject: =?UTF-8?B?bmjDom4gdmnDqm4gdGjDtG5nIHRpbg==?= From: [REDACTED] <phuonghoa1708@gmail.com> To: [REDACTED] Content-Type: multipart/mixed; boundary=f46d043c81e4c9f5f3050e5032cf Bcc: [REDACTED] Attachments: PPF_D6.doc (379719 bytes); ----- END EMAIL HEADER -----
The body of the email was blank. A machine translation from Vietnamese of the subject of the email is "Staff/employee information/inform".
The email contained an attachment that was an incomplete file.

This is a Microsoft Word document that contains code to exploit the CVE-2012-0158 vulnerability. The file PPF_D6.doc was cut off due to unknown reasons, but it contained an embedded file that was likely a malicious implant.
The embedded file was incomplete, so it could not be dynamically executed, and only basic static analysis is possible. However, it is a PE executable file. The intended filename and hash of this file are unknown, however the PE header suggests the file should be of size 20480 bytes (20KB). The file had a static domain embedded within it. The domain was "dangcongsan.vn".

This is the domain embedded within the incomplete file. It is likely a malware callout domain. According to open sources, "dangcongsan.vn" with the IP Address 123.30.192.42 is the website for the Communist Party of Vietnam Online Newspaper.
